data.taskTitle: on /sessions all projects have the same green color
on /sessions all projects have the same green color
data.approach: The issue is that getProjectColor() returns hash-based fallback colors during initial render because the API fetch has not completed yet. Since the projectColors module uses a plain JS object (not reactive Svelte state), the component does not re-render when colors arrive. Fix: Add a reactive state variable projectColors in the sessions page that gets populated when colors are fetched, and use that for row border colors instead of calling getProjectColor directly.

summary: Investigated issue with project colors not displaying correctly on /sessions page
Identified and fixed color rendering logic for project indicators
Ensured each project retains its unique color representation

suggestedTasks.title: Add color consistency tests for project indicators
suggestedTasks.description: Create unit and integration tests to verify project color rendering across different views. Focus on the /sessions page and ensure each project maintains its unique color consistently. Tests should cover edge cases like multiple projects and color assignment logic.

suggestedTasks.title: Document project color rendering implementation
suggestedTasks.description: Create documentation explaining how project colors are assigned and rendered in the application. Include details about the color selection algorithm, how colors are stored, and how they are applied across different UI components. This will help future developers understand the color system.

gotchas: Color rendering logic may be spread across multiple components
